title: StandardDichroic
description: A Dichroic used in the standard fluorecence Ligh Path.

DichroicType.description: The type of dichroic mirror used in this case.

HardSputtered.description: This field records whether this coating of this dichroic is hard-sputtered or traditional.

AttenuationLevel.description: The attenuation level, aka blocking level, is used as a measure of the out-of-band attenuation of an optical filter or dichroic mirror over an extended range of the spectrum. The attenuation level is often defined in units of optical density (OD), wherease OD= -log10(T), and T=Transmittance (0?T?1).

AttenuationMethod.description: The mean by which this dichroic filter achieves out-of-band transmission attenuation.

Technology.description: The main types of filter technology used in fluorescence analysis are absorption (aka colored) glass, thin-film coating, and acousto-optical tunable, liquid-crystal tunable filters.

Polarization.description: The polarization state of this dichroic.

FilterWheel.description: A filter 'wheel' in OME can refer to any arrangement of filters in a filter holder of any shape. It could, for example, be a filter slider

TransmittanceProfileFile.description: This contains the location of file in .csv or other suitable formats containing the wavelenght profile of this component.

ReflectanceProfileFile.description: This contains the location of file in .csv or other suitable formats containing the wavelenght profile of this component.

Name.description: A user defined name for this component.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this component.

Reflectance.description: The amount of light the mirror reflects at a maximum. It is represented as a fraction, as a value from 0.0 to 1.0

MirrorType.description: The general category to which this lens belongs.

Geometry.description: The geometrical shape of the surface of this mirror

AngleOfIncidence.description: This field records the optimal angle of incidence (AOI) for this mirror. TheAOI is the angle between the optical axis of the incident light and the axis normal to the surface of the mirror. In specular reflection AOI is by definition equal to the Angle Of Reflection (AOR).

AngleOfIncidenceUnit.description: This field records the optimal angle of incidence (AOI) for this mirror. TheAOI is the angle between the optical axis of the incident light and the axis normal to the surface of the mirror. In specular reflection AOI is by definition equal to the Angle Of Reflection (AOR).

RadiusOfCurvature.description: A spherical lens or mirror surface has a center of curvature located either along or decentered from the system local optical axis. The vertex of the lens surface is located on the local optical axis. The distance from the vertex to the center of curvature is the radius of curvature of the surface

SubstrateType.description: This field records the type of substrate that is used for the beamsplitter coating. It is typically a ground and polished piece of optical glass.

SubstrateMaterial.description: This records the chemical composition or the nonproprietary trade designation of the mirror's optical substrate. For dichoric mirrors the substrate is typically composed of a glass material with low autofluorescence, such as UV-grade fused silica.

GlassCode.description: If available provide the international glass code. This is based on U.S. military standard MIL-G-174, and is a six-digit number specifying the glass according to its refractive index nd at the Fraunhofer d- (or D3-) line, and its Abbe number Vd also taken at that line. The resulting glass code is the value of nd-1 rounded to three digits, followed by Vd rounded to three digits, with all decimal points ignored. For example, BK7 has nd = 1.5168 and Vd = 64.17, giving a six-digit glass code of 517642

SerialNumber.description: The serial number of this component

LotNumber.description: The lot number of this component

SpecsFile.description: Provide the location of a PDF file with the specifications for the component as provided by the manufacturer.

Description.title: Description
Description.description: The AnnotationRef element is a reference to an element derived from the CommentAnnotation element, which consists of a simple comment multi-line annotation.

TransmittanceRange.description: This records the range of wavelengths that are transmitted by the filter. It also records the maximum amount of light transmitted. Multiple of this elements can be used.

CutIn.description: CutIn is the wavelength below which the response rate is below 50%.

CutOut.description: CutOut is the wavelength above which the response rate is below 50%.

Transmittance.description: The amount of light the filter transmits at a maximum. A fraction, as a value from 0.0 to 1.0.

ReflectanceRange.description: This records the range of wavelengths that are reflected by the mirror.

CutIn.description: CutIn is the wavelength below which the response rate is below 50%.

CutOut.description: CutOut is the wavelength above which the response rate is below 50%.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
